dt: {bc}a small religious house dependent on a monastery or convent
{bc}a one-room dwelling occupied by a solitary person (such as a hermit)
{bc}a single room (as in a convent or prison) usually for one person
{bc}a small compartment, cavity, or bounded space: such as
{bc}a {d_link|membranous|membranous} area bounded by veins in the wing of an insect

{bc}a small usually microscopic mass of {d_link|protoplasm|protoplasm} bounded externally by a {d_link|semipermeable|semipermeable} membrane, usually including one or more nuclei and various other {d_link|organelles|organelle} with their products, capable alone or interacting with other cells of performing all the fundamental functions of life, and forming the smallest structural unit of living matter capable of functioning independently
{bc}a receptacle containing electrodes and an electrolyte either for generating electricity by chemical action or for use in {d_link|electrolysis|electrolysis}

{bc}a single unit in a device for converting {d_link|radiant energy|radiant energy} into electrical energy or for varying the intensity of an electrical current in accordance with radiation {dx_def}see {dxt|radiation||1}{/dx_def}
{bc}a unit in a statistical array {dx_def}see {dxt|array:2||5}{/dx_def} (such as a spreadsheet) formed by the intersection of a column and a row
{bc}a basic and usually small unit of an organization or movement
{bc}a portion of the atmosphere that behaves as a unit
{bc}any of the small sections of a geographic area of a cellular {dx_def}see {dxt|cellular:1||3}{/dx_def} telephone system

art.capt: cell 4 (schematic): {it}A{/it} plant, {it}B{/it} animal; {it}1{/it} cell wall, {it}2{/it} middle lamella, {it}3{/it} plasma membrane, {it}4{/it} mitochondrion, {it}5{/it} vacuole, {it}6{/it} Golgi apparatus, {it}7{/it} cytoplasm, {it}8{/it} nuclear membrane, {it}9{/it} nucleolus, {it}10{/it} nucleus, {it}11{/it} chromatin, {it}12{/it} endoplasmic reticulum with associated ribosomes, {it}13{/it} chloroplast, {it}14{/it} centriole, {it}15{/it} lysosome

et: Middle English, from Old English, religious house and Anglo-French {it}celle{/it} hermit's cell, from Latin {it}cella{/it} small room; akin to Latin {it}celare{/it} to conceal {ma}{mat|hell|}{/ma}
shortdef: a small religious house dependent on a monastery or convent
a one-room dwelling occupied by a solitary person (such as a hermit)
a single room (as in a convent or prison) usually for one person

dt: {bc}a transparent sheet of celluloid on which objects are drawn or painted in the making of animated cartoons

shortdef: a transparent sheet of celluloid on which objects are drawn or painted in the making of animated cartoons

dt: {bc}a branch of biology dealing with the structure, function, and life history of cells and their constituents {bc}{sx|cytology||1a}

shortdef: a branch of biology dealing with the structure, function, and life history of cells and their constituents : cytology

dt: {bc}the nucleus-containing central part of a neuron exclusive of its axons and dendrites that is the major structural element of the {d_link|gray matter|gray matter} of the brain and spinal cord, the {d_link|ganglia|ganglion}, and the {d_link|retina|retina} {dx}see {dxt|neuron|neuron|illustration}{/dx}

shortdef: the nucleus-containing central part of a neuron exclusive of its axons and dendrites that is the major structural element of the gray matter of the brain and spinal cord, the ganglia, and the retina

dt: {bc}the complete series of events from one cell division to the next {dx}compare {dxt|g{inf}1{/inf} phase||}, {dxt|g{inf}2{/inf} phase||}, {dxt|m phase||}, {dxt|s phase||}{/dx}

shortdef: the complete series of events from one cell division to the next

dt: {bc}the process by which cells multiply involving both nuclear and cytoplasmic division {dx}compare {dxt|meiosis||}, {dxt|mitosis||}{/dx}

shortdef: the process by which cells multiply involving both nuclear and cytoplasmic division

dt: {bc}a cell culture selected for uniformity from a cell population derived from a usually homogeneous tissue source (such as an organ)

dt.t: a newly established {it}cell line{/it} derived from a human endometrial carcinoma

shortdef: a cell culture selected for uniformity from a cell population derived from a usually homogeneous tissue source (such as an organ)

dt: {bc}relating to or being the part of immunity or the immune response that is mediated primarily by T cells

shortdef: relating to or being the part of immunity or the immune response that is mediated primarily by T cells

dt: {bc}a semipermeable limiting layer of cell protoplasm consisting of a fluid {d_link|phospholipid|phospholipid} bilayer with intercalated proteins {bc}{sx|plasma membrane||}

dt.t: Despite being much maligned in the popular press, cholesterol plays a crucial role in organizing {wi}cell membranes{/wi} and controlling their physical properties.
… a cascade of reactions culminating in the transfer of a phosphate group to a protein complex that carries ions across the {wi}cell membrane{/wi}.

shortdef: a membrane of a cell; especially : a semipermeable limiting layer of cell protoplasm consisting of a fluid phospholipid bilayer with intercalated proteins : plasma membrane

dt: {bc}a portable usually cordless telephone for use in a cellular system

shortdef: a portable usually cordless telephone for use in a cellular system
